data.question: What are the synthesis conditions for the cyclam-based ligands used in the construction of VPI-100 MOFs?
data.answer: The cyclam-based ligands were synthesized based on previous reports with minor modifications, using a 5-step synthetic route starting from Cu(II) perchlorate and ethylene diamine.

data.question: How were the structures of VPI-100 (Cu) and VPI-100 (Ni) determined?
data.answer: The structures of VPI-100 (Cu) and VPI-100 (Ni) were determined by means of the PXRD technique using synchrotron radiation, with XRD indexing and Rietveld analysis performed with TOPAS version 5.

data.question: What method was used to confirm the permanent porosity of VPI-100 MOFs?
data.answer: The permanent porosity of VPI-100 MOFs was confirmed by N2 adsorption isotherm measurements taken at 77 K.

data.question: What was the role of tetrabutylammonium bromide (TBAB) in the cycloaddition reactions of CO2 to epoxides using VPI-100?
data.answer: Tetrabutylammonium bromide (TBAB) was used as a co-catalyst in the cycloaddition reactions of CO2 to epoxides using VPI-100.

data.question: How was the conversion rate in the cycloaddition reactions of CO2 to epoxides using VPI-100 determined?
data.answer: The conversion rate in the cycloaddition reactions was determined by comparison of the 1H NMR integrals of the corresponding proton in the starting material and in the product.

data.question: What was the outcome of using VPI-100 MOFs as catalysts for the cycloaddition of CO2 with epoxide 6a?
data.answer: Using VPI-100 MOFs as catalysts for the cycloaddition of CO2 with epoxide 6a resulted in high conversion yields, with VPI-100 (Ni) achieving up to 98% conversion.

data.question: True or False: The VPI-100 MOFs maintained their crystallinity and structure after being used in cycloaddition reactions.
data.answer: True. The VPI-100 MOFs largely retained their crystallinity and structure after being used in cycloaddition reactions, as evidenced by PXRD patterns.

data.question: True or False: The VPI-100 MOFs demonstrated poor chemical stability in various organic and aqueous-based solvents.
data.answer: False. The VPI-100 MOFs demonstrated excellent chemical stability in various organic and aqueous-based solvents over a wide pH range.

data.question: What was the effect of thermal treatment on the BET surface area of VPI-100 (Ni)?
data.answer: The BET surface area of VPI-100 (Ni) decreased from 612 to 485 m2/g after thermal treatment at 220 Â°C.

data.question: True or False: The synthesis of VPI-100 MOFs involved a modulated synthetic approach.
data.answer: True. A modulated synthetic approach was highly effective for the synthesis of the novel class of metallo-cyclam Zr-MOFs, VPI-100.
